trans-unit.source: Provides basic functionality for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref> control.

Although ToolStripDropDownMenu and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> replace and add functionality to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Menu"></xref> control of previous versions, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Menu"></xref> is retained for both backward compatibility and future use if you choose.
ToolStripDropDownMenu is the base class for <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip>, providing necessary painting and layout properties and methods.

The properties of this class that you are most likely to use directly are the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownMenu.ShowCheckMargin%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownMenu.ShowImageMargin%2A> properties, which determine whether the shortcut menu will be able to display a check mark, an image, or both.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownMenu"></xref> class.

Creates a default <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref> with the specified text, image, and event handler on a new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownMenu"></xref>.
Use the CreateDefaultItem method to add a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem> with commonly used characteristics to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownMenu>.
The text to use for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref>.
If the `text` parameter is a hyphen (-), this method creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSeparator"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref>.
An event handler that raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Click"></xref> event when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref> is clicked.
A , or a if the text parameter is a hyphen (-).
Gets the internal spacing, in pixels, of the control.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_Padding" name="Padding" href=""></xref> object representing the spacing.
Gets the rectangle that represents the display area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownMenu"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the display area.
Passes a reference to the cached <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LayoutEngine*> returned by the layout engine interface.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.LayoutEngine"></xref> that represents the cached layout engine returned by the layout engine interface.
Gets or sets a value indicating how the items of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref> are displayed.
By default, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip> items flow horizontally or vertically as necessary.
See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle> enumeration for the other possibilities.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLayoutStyle"></xref>.
Gets the maximum height and width, in pixels, of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref>.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_Size" name="Size" href=""></xref> object representing the height and width of the control, in pixels.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.FontChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnFontChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Layout"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnLayout method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Paints the background of the control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Resets the collection of displayed and overflow items after a layout is done.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether space for a check mark is shown on the left edge of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref>.
Set the ShowCheckMargin property to `true` to display a check mark when the user chooses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the check margin is shown; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether space for an image is shown on the left edge of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref>.
Set the ShowImageMargin property to `true` to display a graphic image with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the image margin is shown; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
